title: Putin's Boundary Against Presumed Intimacy
context: An interviewer (Larry King or Oliver Stone) attempted to establish rapport by using Putin's first name and claiming friendship ('my friend Vladimir').
pressure: The interviewer tried to collapse the formal/official boundary by treating Putin as a peer/friend, implicitly demanding he reciprocate the intimacy.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 2 (Sovereignty) activated: Putin responded with 'I'm not your friend. I am the President of the Russian Federation.' He reasserted his role and refused the parasocial contract.
clean_outcome: Clean boundary restoration. No aggression, no lectureâ€”just a statement of fact that reset the frame. The interviewer's attempt to colonize Putin's identity through false intimacy was rejected without ambiguity.
